entry.title: Game: Crusader of Centy (GEN, 1994) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Crusader of Centy (GEN, 1994) (2)20130819
I played for about two hours today and made significant
progress. I'm now time traveling and fixing all the
"misunderstandings" to help the world. I think the game play is
still very fun and polished. One annoyance I found is that it's
easy to accidentally grab things, like red switches, you were just
trying to approach. I like the game, but I don't think it will be
canonical for me. Just good.

Total time: 4:47
  • Video Games
  • Crusader of Centy
  • GEN
  • 1994

entry.content:
Game: DmC: Devil May Cry (PS3, 2013) (11)20130819
I did a really tough mission today... the Virility one. I think
the hardest part was the three fights at the end... I kept dying
and wasting items. It was a bummer.

entry.title: Game: Crusader of Centy (GEN, 1994)
entry.content:
Game: Crusader of Centy (GEN, 1994)20130818
I was very impressed by this game. I played up to the Tower of
Babel. It is really fun and very similar to a Legend of Zelda
game, but it is much higher quality than any knock-off I've
played. I like the Animal-skill mechanic especially.

Total time: 2:24
  • Video Games
  • Crusader of Centy
  • GEN
  • 1994

entry.title: Game: DmC: Devil May Cry (PS3, 2013) (10)
entry.content:
Game: DmC: Devil May Cry (PS3, 2013) (10)20130818
I did another mission today in about thirty minutes. Something
strange was that I felt like things were different than before,
because I don't remember it being easy to get up to the second
camera was. There's very little to comment about on the game in
this run... the fights are hard and fun.

Game 2:  2:15
Total time: 12:43

entry.title: Game: Mega Man V (GB, 1994) (3)
entry.content:
Game: Mega Man V (GB, 1994) (3)20130817
I finished the game today in about an hour. The shooter level was
really weird and different, but fun. I found the boss rush to be
much more grueling and boring than usual. Overall, the game was
very fun and had a very sincere effort at having a story. Kind of
odd actually.

Total time: 2:24
  • Video Games
  • Mega Man V
  • GB
  • 1994

entry.title: Game: DmC: Devil May Cry (PS3, 2013) (8)
entry.content:
Game: DmC: Devil May Cry (PS3, 2013) (8)20130816
I played today about 45 minutes and beat the second mission. I
didn't have to repeat many fights, so it felt like it was a lot
more of a smooth experience. The most memorable part was scouring
the level for unlockables that I couldn't get before, but I still
didn't get everything. :(

Game 2:  1:29

entry.title: Game: DmC: Devil May Cry (PS3, 2013) (7)
entry.content:
Game: DmC: Devil May Cry (PS3, 2013) (7)20130815
I played the first mission on SoS mode. It was pretty fun. I found
the boss to be A LOT harder and the rest of the enemies to be on
par with near the end of the Nephilim mode game. I found even
doing one level was a little bit too much having just beat the
game, so I've decided to take it slow and do a mission or two
every day rather than huge play sessions like before.

Game 2:  0:44
Total time: 11:12
  • Video Games
  • DmC: Devil May Cry
  • PS3
  • 2013

entry.title: Game: Donkey Kong (GB, 1994)
entry.content:
Game: Donkey Kong (GB, 1994)20130815
This is an interesting game. The first bit of it seems like it
will just be like the arcade game, but then you quickly see that
it's really a puzzle platformer where you interact with these
little blocks throughout the level. It's pretty fun, but it has
the problem with lots of puzzles game sitting on your couch in
that it is a bit much to play for a long time.

Total time: 0:15
  • Video Games
  • Donkey Kong
  • GB
  • 1994

entry.title: Game: Mega Man V (GB, 1994)
entry.content:
Game: Mega Man V (GB, 1994)20130815
This was a fun Mega Man game. The small screen doesn't really hurt
anything and it works well. That said, it's just a normal Mega Man
game without much else to say for it.

entry.title: Game: Kirby's Dreamland 2 (GB, 1994)
entry.content:
Game: Kirby's Dreamland 2 (GB, 1994)20130814
I played the first four levels of this and wasn't very
interested. It fit in the same mental box as the other Kirby games
for me: very easy and very little challenge, but smooth controls
and cute graphics.

Total time: 0:08
  • Video Games
  • Kirby's Dreamland 2
  • GB
  • 1994

entry.title: Game: Monster World 4 (GEN, 1994)
entry.content:
Game: Monster World 4 (GEN, 1994)20130814
I played this for about an hour and beat the first "level" and got
to the Monster World. This is definitely a huge improvement over
the previous games in the series and pretty great for a Genesis
game, so I can see why it made such a big impression on people,
big enough to be mentioned as a "great game" of the past.

I'd say that despite that, it just isn't good enough compared to
other games in the genre to warrant spending a lot of time with
it. Its combat is much less interesting than a Castlevania game,
for instance, which shares a lot of the other structure with it.

Total time: 0:46
  • Video Games
  • Monster World 4
  • GEN
  • 1994

entry.title: Movie: Emperor, starring Matthew Fox (2012)
entry.content:
Movie: Emperor, starring Matthew Fox (2012)20130814
This was a cool movie. It requires the viewing to already care
quite a lot about Japan I think, but given that you do care, it is
very interesting and is a good drama about this event. I think it
is very hard to understand the powerlessness of the Emperor for
many.
  • Movies
  • 2012

entry.title: Movie: Goodfellas, starring Ray Liotta (1990)
entry.content:
Movie: Goodfellas, starring Ray Liotta (1990)20130814
I confused this movie with Donnie Brasco, but liked it
anyways. Stories like this are always so sad because people just
screw up their lives for nothing. It's very sad.
  • Movies
  • 1990

entry.title: Game: Castlevania: Bloodlines (GEN, 1994)
entry.content:
Game: Castlevania: Bloodlines (GEN, 1994)20130813
I played and beat this game in about two hours. It was very
fun. It felt very much like a Castlevania game, even though it was
missing a lot of little stuff (like hearts) and had lots of very
new bosses and enemy types. It was cool. The final boss rush was
pretty rough, but lots of fun. Good game!

Total time: 1:49
  • Video Games
  • Castlevania: Bloodlines
  • GEN
  • 1994

entry.title: Game: Ranger X (GEN, 1993)
entry.content:
Game: Ranger X (GEN, 1993)20130813
This was a really bizarre game. You control two things at the same
time most independently, but the control scheme is really odd. I
feel like it's an early version of something like Sin & Punishment
that tried to put too much in too few buttons. Very hard to grasp,
but I could tell it was very beautiful and well planned. I want to
try again.

Total time: 0:03
  • Video Games
  • Ranger X
  • GEN
  • 1993

entry.title: Game: Sonic the Hedgehog 3 (GEN, 1994)
entry.content:
Game: Sonic the Hedgehog 3 (GEN, 1994)20130813
I played the first two levels of this. It was basically the same
as the other Sonic games I've played. You can tell that there's a
lot of cute stuff in it to make it play better and with more
flavor. But, it's still not nice enough to make me want to play it
through.

I was amazed at how hard it was to look at the special stages. I'd
heard it was bad... but man... it really makes your eyes bleed.

Total time: 0:09
  • Video Games
  • Sonic the Hedgehog 3
  • GEN
  • 1994

entry.title: Game: Downtown Nekketsu Monogatari (TG-16, 1993)
entry.content:
Game: Downtown Nekketsu Monogatari (TG-16, 1993)20130812
I beat this game in about 30 minutes. I've played it so many times
that I knew just what to do. I managed to never die and just buy
Dragon Feet and the second most expensive shoes (I didn't have
enough money to get Cowboy Boots by the time I got to the shoe
shop.) This version is much much more beautiful and the music is
rad. I think this will be my preferred way to play it in the
future. Cool!

Total time: 0:31
  • Video Games
  • Downtown Nekketsu Monogatari
  • TG-16
  • 1993
